help.title: XAMS Accounts
help.information: XAMS reaches a maximum of flexibility and functionality in the sector of administration because of its special grouping system. There are three different kinds of management instances called "Administrators", "Resellers" and "Customers".

section.head: Administrators
section.description: An Administrator can take up changes on all data without any limitations. He has total access to every function of XAMS and thus can administrate all Resellers and where required even whose Customers.

section.head: Resellers
section.description: An Administrator assigns any desired sites definitely to one Reseller. These sites then can be just administrated by this special Reseller. Here, he has to keep to the limitations given by the Administrator. He may apply - according to the limits - any desired Customers and also manage them. In contrast to the Administrator, he cannot take up changes to the system settings, to the field-configuration in the addressbook and it is not possible for him to analyse the database. In addition to that he cannot gain access to the customers belonging to another Reseller of course.

section.head: Customers
section.description: A Reseller (resp. Administrator) assigns any desired sites to a Customer. These sites then can be administrated by the Customer. Here, he has to keep to the limitations given by the Reseller (resp. Administrator). He may apply - according to the limits - any desired users or aliases and also manage them. In contrast to the Reseller, he cannot gain access to the users or aliases belonging to another Customer of course.
